name: Which Dog Does the Job? Quiz | Dogs | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
Beagle.

	The beagle was bred to hunt rabbits in packs. The white tail tip makes the dog easy to see, and the melodious bay makes it easy to hear!

Scottish terrier.

	Most small terriers were bred as vermin killers.

Borzoi.

	The Borzoi is also known as the 'Russian wolfhound.'

Cardigan Welsh corgi.

	The other dogs were bred to herd sheep. The short and squat corgi can avoid kicks by enraged cattle.

Pointer.

	The pointer points out the birds.

English springer spaniel.

	The Springer charges through the bushes, 'putting up' gamebirds.

questions.text: Retrieving large quantities of ducks and geese from icy water, particularly in North America.
questions.explanation:
Chesapeake Bay retriever.

	The Chessie was used by market hunters in frigid winter weather.

Doberman pinscher.

	The Doberman was developed by Louis Dobermann as his personal breed of guard dog.

Chihuahua.

	The Chihuahua is descended from dogs used in Mexico as food.

Chow chow.

	The Chow was used for both food and fur. Black Chows were believed to be an aphrodisiac.

questions.text: Which dog was bred to lure ducks toward shore for hunters?
questions.explanation:
Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever.

	The Toller lures ducks to shore by prancing and waving his tail as he plays with a stick.

questions.text: Which dog would you acquire to guard your barge?
questions.explanation:
Keeshond.

	This Dutch breed was originally a barge guard.

questions.text: Which dog would accompany you on a lion hunt?
questions.explanation:
Rhodesian Ridgeback.

	This breed was developed specifically for hunting lions.

questions.text: Which breed would sit on a poacher if he found one on your estate?
questions.explanation:
Bullmastiff.

	Often known as the 'gamekeeper's night watchman', the bullmastiff was bred to subdue intruders rather than to bite them.

questions.text: Which dog would climb rocks to get a puffin for you (puffins are seabirds that look vaguely like penguins)?
questions.explanation:
Norwegian Lundehund.

	This odd breed, which looks rather like a Corgi, has extra toes for climbing and a very flexible body for going down puffin holes.
